Mdat.name: name
Mdat.description: The human-readable name of the ADM.

Mdat.name: organization
Mdat.description: The name of the issuing organization of the ADM.

Tblt.name: ltp_rx_rules
Tblt.description: This table lists all LTP segment authentication rulesin the security policy database.

Tblt.name: ltp_tx_rules
Tblt.description: This table lists all LTP segment signing rules in the security policy database.

Ctrl.name: key_add
Ctrl.description: This control adds a named key value to the security policy database. The content of file_name is taken as the value of the key.Named keys can be referenced by other elements of thesecurity policy database.

Ctrl.name: key_change
Ctrl.description: This control changes the value of the named key, obtaining the new key value from the content of file_name.

Ctrl.name: key_del
Ctrl.description: This control deletes the key identified by name.

Ctrl.name: ltp_rx_rule_add
Ctrl.description: This control adds a rule specifying the manner in which LTP segment authentication will be applied to LTP segmentsrecieved from the indicated LTP engine. A segment from the indicated LTP engine will only be deemed authentic if it contains an authentication extension computed via the ciphersuite identified by ciphersuite_nbr using the applicable key value. If ciphersuite_nbr is 255 then the applicable key value is a hard-coded constant and key_name must be omitted; otherwise key_nameis required and the applicable key value is the current value of the key named key_name in the local security policy database. Valid values of ciphersuite_nbr are: 0: HMAC-SHA1-80 1: RSA-SHA256 255: NULL

Ctrl.name: ltp_rx_rule_change
Ctrl.description: This control changes the parameters of the LTP segment authentication rule for the indicated LTP engine.

Ctrl.name: ltp_rx_rule_del
Ctrl.description: This control deletes the LTP segment authentication rule for the indicated LTP engine.

Ctrl.name: ltp_tx_rule_add
Ctrl.description: This control adds a rule specifying the manner in which LTP segments transmitted to the indicated LTP engine mustbe signed. Signing a segment destined for the indicated LTP engineentails computing an authentication extension via the ciphersuite identified by ciphersuite_nbr using the applicable key value. If ciphersuite_nbr is 255 then the applicable key value is a hard-coded constant and key_name must be omitted; otherwise key_nameis required and the applicable key value is the current value of the key named key_name in the local security policy database.Valid values of ciphersuite_nbr are: 0:HMAC_SHA1-80 1: RSA_SHA256 255: NULL

Ctrl.name: ltp_tx_rule_change
Ctrl.description: This control changes the parameters of the LTP segment signing rule for the indicated LTP engine.

Ctrl.name: ltp_tx_rule_del
Ctrl.description: This control deletes the LTP segment signing rule forthe indicated LTP engine.

Ctrl.name: list_keys
Ctrl.description: This control lists the names of keys available in the key policy database.

Ctrl.name: list_ltp_rx_rules
Ctrl.description: This control lists all LTP segment authentication rules in the security policy database.

Ctrl.name: list_ltp_tx_rules
Ctrl.description: This control lists all LTP segment signing rules in the security policy database.
